title: How to say Happy Valentine's Day in 22 different languages | Metro News
text:
Imogen Groome for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 9:13 am (Picture: Getty) 
Whether we are celebrating with a loved one, friends, or simply treating the day like any other, it is likely that at some point today you will hear the words ‘Happy Valentine’s Day’. 
The phrase may make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside, or it may make you shudder – whatever your response, it is something you will have to deal with once a year. Teachers caught playing 'f***, marry, kill' game about students 
However, if you’re sick of hearing the greeting, why not confuse your friends and family by returning it – in an entirely different language? 
You may feel like saying it in French, so that those who took it at GCSE have a vague idea of what you’re on about. 
Or you could go for an entirely unfamiliar language and bask in the confusion that arises. 
Either way, here’s how to say ‘Happy Valentine’s Day’ in 22 different languages. (Picture: Getty) 
Alles Gute zum Valentins Tag – German 
Feliz Dia De San Valentin – Spanish 
Feliz Dia dos Namorados – Portugese 
Valentines sásta lá – Irish 
Masaya Araw ng mga Puso – Filipino (Picture: Getty)
